content: Hi, I saw your listing for the condo on 5th Avenue. Is it still available? I'm pre-approved up to $500K and looking to move quickly. Can we schedule a showing this weekend? Thanks, Kevin

Hi Kevin, Thanks for your interest in the 5th Avenue condo! Yes, it's still available. I'd love to show it to you this weekend. Are you available Saturday at 2 PM or Sunday at 11 AM? I'll also send you some comparable properties that might interest you. Looking forward to hearing from you! Best, Jessica Chen

Called Emily to follow up on yesterday's showing at Hillcrest condo. She loved the kitchen and the location but has concerns about the HOA fees ($450/month). Discussed comparable properties with lower fees in the area. She's interested in seeing 3 more properties this weekend - sent her listings for Banker's Hill, University Heights, and Normal Heights condos. All under $500K with lower HOA fees. Scheduling showings for Saturday morning.

OFFER ACCEPTED! Robert's offer on 123 Ocean View Drive in La Jolla has been accepted. Purchase price: $1.2M, 30-day close, buyer waived appraisal contingency due to cash position. Home inspection scheduled for Monday 11/25 at 10 AM with Mark Thompson from Elite Inspections. Need to coordinate with Rachel Martinez at Secure Title for escrow opening. Final walkthrough scheduled for day before close. Robert is excited and ready to move forward quickly.

Hi Jennifer, I have a client, Robert Williams, who needs financing for a $1.2M purchase in La Jolla. He's a cash buyer but wants to maintain liquidity for his business. Looking for a jumbo loan at approximately 70% LTV. He has excellent credit (780+) and significant assets. Can you help with this? He's available for a call today after 3 PM or tomorrow morning. The property is already under contract with a 30-day close. Thanks! Amanda

James called about the Sorrento Valley townhome listing. He's relocating from Seattle for a tech job and needs to close quickly. Budget is $800K-$900K, pre-approved with his current lender but open to local recommendations. Wants modern finishes, 2-car garage, and good schools nearby. Scheduled showing for Thursday at 6 PM after work. Also sending him 3 other listings in the area that match his criteria. He seems very motivated and timeline-driven.

Met with Maria at her Encinitas home to discuss listing strategy. Home is well-maintained 4BR/3BA built in 2018, approximately 2,400 sq ft. Comparable sales suggest listing price of $1.1M-$1.15M. Maria needs to sell before relocating to Phoenix for her husband's job transfer. Timeline is flexible but prefers to close by end of January. Discussed staging recommendations and minor improvements (paint touch-ups, landscaping). Photographer scheduled for next week. Will prepare CMA and listing agreement for Friday meeting.

Called Thomas for his one-year home anniversary check-in. He's very happy with his Hillcrest purchase and the neighborhood. Asked about home value appreciation - shared recent comps showing 8% increase since his purchase. He mentioned his brother is looking to buy in San Diego and asked for a referral. Getting brother's contact info and will reach out this week. Thomas also interested in refinancing to take advantage of lower rates. Connected him with Jennifer Adams at Pacific Coast Lending.

Property inspection call with Chris Gabriel. Discussed inspection findings for property under consideration. Key issues identified: furnace from 2008 (16 years old), AC from 2011, roof from 2010 needing patches, stairs framing needs support, dryer vent requires updating. Estimated immediate repair costs $1500-2000. Chris comparing this property with another option that's move-in ready but has $200/month higher maintenance fees. Timeline pressure - conditions due at 6pm, competing offers in play. Chris expressed concerns about repair costs vs. move-in ready alternative. Need decision today on whether to proceed with offer or pursue other property.
